byline.contributor: Michael Luo is deputy Metro editor and an editor on the Race/Related team at The New York Times. He can be reached on Twitter @MichaelLuo.

abstract: New York Times Metro editor Michael Luo pens open letter to woman on Upper East Side of Manhattan who screamed at him and his family to go back to China; underscores degree to which Asian-American experience is often characterized by persistent sense of otherness.
lead_paragraph: After a racist attack on his family on the streets of the Upper East Side, a New York Times editor wonders whether Asian-Americans will ever feel like they belong.
snippet: After a racist attack on his family on the streets of the Upper East Side, a New York Times editor wonders whether Asian-Americans will ever feel like they belong....

headline.main: An Open Letter to the Woman Who Told My Family to Go Back to China
headline.print_headline: An Open Letter to the Woman Who Told Us: Go Back to China
